title: Strikes Hit Staging Ground for Troops in Russia’s Border Region
description: Explosions rocked Belgorod and the city of Donetsk on Sunday, signaling that the mayhem unleashed by Russia’s invasion is spreading far beyond the front lines.

title: Your Monday Briefing: China’s Leader Warns of ‘Stormy Seas’
description: Plus explosions in the Russian city of Belgorod and a fire at a notorious prison in Iran.

title: Russian troops have started to arrive in Belarus.
Russia’s Draft Sends Barely Trained Men to War in Ukraine
description: Newly mobilized recruits are already at the front in Ukraine, a growing chorus of reports says, fighting and dying after only days of training.

title: Tens of Thousands March in Paris to Protest Rising Living Costs
description: The demonstration occurred on the heels of strikes at oil refineries, adding to a tense political atmosphere.

title: A blast damages an administration building in Russian-occupied eastern Ukraine, killing one man.
Elections Approaching, Erdogan Raises the Heat Again With Greece
description: Turkey’s president suggested that troops “may suddenly arrive one night” in Greece. With inflation rampant and the lira sinking, a manufactured crisis might be just the thing he needs.

title: How Ukraine’s Surrogate Mothers Have Survived the War
description: When Russia invaded, Ukraine’s once-booming surrogacy industry seemed at risk of collapsing. But surrogate mothers and agencies have managed to continue deliveries, and clients are arriving again to pick up their children.

title: China’s Leader Xi Hails His Rule as He Prepares to Expand Power
description: Xi Jinping is expected to secure a third term as leader during a pivotal meeting of the Communist Party, extending his authoritarian rule over the country.

title: Macron the Disrupter Seeks Direction
description: He wants to lead a united Europe to independence. But the world has changed on him.

title: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s Debut
description: She has spoken more extensively than other newcomers to the Supreme Court have.

title: On tech, Xi points to self-reliance and state-led initiatives.
description: Mr. Xi signaled that little would change on tech policy, as he emphasized internet controls, state-led innovation projects and a battle for key core technology.

title: China Doubles Down on ‘Covid Zero’ Despite Economic Toll
description: Xi Jinping doubled down on the idea that the measures have saved lives and vowed to continue the stringent set of policies.

title: On Taiwan, Xi Jinping warns against international ‘interference.’
description: The Chinese leader struck a firm note on unification with Taiwan, saying that Beijing reserved the right to use force.

title: Live Updates: Xi Says Taiwan ‘Issue’ Is China’s Internal Matter
description: Mr. Xi, in a speech that lasted about two hours, said China wants to unify with Taiwan peacefully but will not rule out using force if provoked. He is expected to secure a third term as leader during the Communist Party congress.

title: Shooting at Russian Training Camp Highlights Chaos Around Conscription
description: Eleven people were killed and 15 wounded in a shooting at a Russian military training camp near the Ukrainian border, Russian state-run media said.

title: Elections Approaching, Erdogan Raises the Heat Again With Greece
description: Turkey’s president suggested that troops “may suddenly arrive one night” in Greece. With inflation rampant and the lira sinking, a manufactured crisis might be just the thing he needs.

title: Russian nuclear fears loom in the geopolitical background for China.
description: On Sunday, Xi Jinping, China’s top leader, skipped the opportunity to note the dangers of nuclear war and the anniversary of the missile crisis of 60 years ago.

title: Elon Musk Says His Company Will Continue to Fund Internet Service in Ukraine
description: The service has been crucial for communications in Ukraine’s army as it advances into territory occupied by Russia.
